title: art shows
name: art shows
description:
A Map by Jason

exhibits i happen to snap photos at, go to, remember, or plan to see, or just know about.  feel free to post to this map too.

properties.name: 9/19/06 8pm :: Bike Powered Film Caravan
properties.description: Posted by Jason   1620 SW Park Ave, Portland, ORALL NIGHT LONG / FILM CARAVAN THE PORTLAND THAT WAS, OUTDOOR EVENT All Night Long is a free, outdoor film show in which the audience travels from site to site to see eight short films in eight related historic sites in downtown Portland. Artist Mack McFarland and film archivist Dennis Nyback will lead the caravan which will go from the South Park Blocks to The Pearl. Audience members traveling on foot, by bike, or on skateboard will see a line up of films which includes classic Hollywood animation featuring the voice of Portlander Mel Blanc, an educational film which features Mayor Terry Shrunk and City Commissioner Neil Goldschmidt being dressed down by Portlanders upset by development in Goose Hollow, a 1940 Republican Party campaign film encouraging voters to choose the Wilkie/McNary ticket, and more. All presented in glorious 16mm on film, not video! All of the projection equipment and films will be transported by bicycle, facilitated by SHIFT www.shift2bikes.org Event: All Night Long Caravan Description: Outdoor site specific screenings of eight short films featured in THE PORTLAND THAT WAS (www.portlandwas.com) Date: Saturday September 16 Time: Dusk (about 8:00 PM) Location: Begins outside Lincoln Hall, 1620 SW Park Cost: Free We can screen this program for the press. Please contact Portland Was at portlandwas@gmail.com to request a screening.

properties.name: Artistic Actions in the Interconnected Urban Territory
properties.description: Posted by Jason Via Jacopo Ruffini 3, Genoa, ItalyThe representation of the territory holds a historical role in the privileges of power. The geographical data has always been in its hands. The regaining of this representation goes through the description and sharing (often in personal perspectives too). This is made possible thanks to the collaborative tools and consequent changing of the value of the maps. These maps are not granted anymore by structures of power, but built by individuals who, drawing on the ideas of the psychogeographical movements, repaint the urban space according to fresh new coordinates. WORKS BY: 01.org Vopos :: Cartografia Resistente Triangolazione :: Les Flottants Lasciare libero il passo :: Giuseppe Chiari Musica verità, Suonare la città, Che cosè un happening :: Vincenzo Agnetti Spazio perduto e spazio costruito :: Guy Debord In girum imus nocte et consumimur igni :: Ernesto Fialdini, Matteo Dentoni Debordare.

properties.name: Bit Torrent, Bring Us Together :: 9/28 event
properties.description: Posted by Jason  403 SW 10th Ave, Portland, ORBit Torrent, Bring Us Together! @ Travelers and Record Sound System (403 SW 10th Ave @ Stark St.) Thursday, Sep. 28th 2006 - 5pm Portland, Or. Bit Torrent, created by Bram Cohen, and released to the public in 2002, enables multiple persons to share information with one another "directly", and simultaneously. The directness of the sharing of this information is nearly invisible. With peer to peer file sharing one may never know who they received the information they were seeking from, all they know is that there are like minds out in the world, and they are gathering together towards a cumulative knowledge base. The similarities present between Bit Torrent file sharing and the democratic voice are overtly apparent - like minds are available, they are talking. It is up to the individual to harness the power of those like minds and accentuate those voices in unison for the strength of the community as a whole. For Bit Torrent, Bring Us Together! Colin Beattie and Sam Gould have create a process oriented dance piece that requires the publics active involvement to play itself out to conclusion - to positive, or negative, results depending on that very involvement. Bit Torrent plays out with individuals serving the roles of Peers, Files, and Trackers, illustrating in real time the correlation between the framework of democratic voice/action, and the Bit Torrent process. Join us, take part in the role you were born to play!

properties.name: Ceramic monster masks at Backspace
properties.description: Posted by Jason 115 nw 5th ave, Portland OregonSome creepy, sinister, organic, salt fired ceramic masks that make me think of monsters and warriors, of gnarly road warrior type post and pre apocolyptic times when survival is not taken for granted.

properties.name: Foghat Ranchero gets a Champagne Shower + brunch
properties.description: Posted by Jason Nat and Scott have been doing this Tailgating project for a while now, where they park their ranchero outside of art events and shindigs and just random places, and give away free beer and hotdogs, grilling off the tailgate. They provide a few chairs and literally call out to passersby, inviting them to join in the party. Now they have an officially sanctioned art event of their own, in association with PICA, they threw a celebratory brunch and champagne shower for their car, sporting the new vanity plates "FOGHAT"

properties.name: Fragile Industries Studios
properties.description: Posted by Fragileindustry  93003Custom Altered Art. Altered books, shrines, altars, memorials, wedding scrapbooks and guest books and just about anything else is personalized with your theme and/or photos or other personal mememtoes. Makes a wonderful gift. My work is collected all over the world and has toured with mixed media exhibitions nationally. I also can custom create embellishments for your own work. I also make altered books, shrines and lots more ready-made and ready to sell. Visit my site for more info!

properties.name: HABERMAN ART - Saturday, October 14, 5 – 9 pm
properties.description: Posted by Jake 1520 se 7th portland or 97214Just an innocent art show reminder. If you happen to be around SE Portland this Saturday evening, stop by and say hello. I have a buncha new work and I really like the walls of this joint (multi color…oohh la la). Invite attached. Info also below with commentary. Saturday, October 14, 5 – 9 pm (Roots Brewery, (1520 SE Seventh Ave Portland, off Hawthorne). Showing (30) paintings for this Autumn opening show, entitled “Young Man Like You, Drunk By Noon” – newly selected works of Chris Haberman. Show runs from Oct. 14 – Nov. 14. Come by and have an “organic” pint from this totally colorful (and independent) local organic brewery. They also feature a Jalapeno beer and the taps are made from Dragonboat paddles. It’s also non-smoking for anyone that happens to be kinda healthy (except for beer drinking of course).

properties.name: Jon Humphries Photo Show @ Cal's Pharmacy Dec. 30th!!!
properties.description: Posted by Jake    15 Ne Hancock St, Portland, ORHey Everyone! Saturday, December 30th, Cal\'s Pharmacy is proud to host a photography show by our very own Portland local gone big time: Jon Humphries. If you don\'t know who Humphries is, let me fill you in: he\'s the ripping-ist skateboard photographer ever. (my humble opinion). He has shot with everyone and for everyone: Transworld, The Skateboard Mag, Danny Way, Arto, P-Rod, T-Hawk, etc. The guy is top notch. Don\'t miss your chance to say what\'s up to Jon and see a new collection of never seen before prints, polaroids and other photographic works of wizardry that he has put together for his custom installation here at Cals Pharmacy. Opening reception: Saturday Dec. 30th 7pm-10pm Cals Pharmacy 11 NE Hancock St. Portland, OR 97217 503-233-1237 Thanks, peace, and Merry Christmas to all...

properties.name: Migration Station - by Micelle Rosenberg
properties.description: Posted by Jason An interactive installation for people and waterfowl. On the waterfront, where a variety of migrating waterfowl pass through Peekskill every Fall, is a tree stump where visitors can activate bird whistles that call out to ducks and geese. Located close by is a small fountain providing fresh water for the migrating birds. The Installation allows a rare opportunity for people to communicate with the birds while highlighting the urban park\'s controlled natural environment. On view during the Peekskill Project September 16 to October 8

properties.name: Stash and Sense at Just Be's Compound Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Jason   107 Northwest 5th Avenue, Portland, OR, 97209A graffiti centric show with modified sneakers, packaged goods, spraycan art on canvas, murals, ink, etc, this opening was packed to the gills. I haven\'t been to a Just Be gallery opening since Pat Fong had work in the old NW 2nd Ave location. I really can\'t believe how huge this thing has become, serious props to the old local old town neighbors!!

properties.name: Walking/Listening/Recording (sound installation)
properties.description: Posted by Jason   Walking/Listening/Recording: Tryon Creek (2006) is a 10-channel sound installation set along the Trillium Trail in Tryon Creek State Park, Portland, Oregon. Along the initial 250ft passage of the Trillium Trail, speakers from hidden locations cast layers of found sounds interwoven with poetic murmurs and field recordings from around the Red Fox Bridge area in the park. William Stafford\'s poem "Walking with Your Eyes Shut" inspired the use of poetry in the piece - to form a dialogue between the visual and audible experience. These layers of sound are intended to engage visitors in a sonic narrative along the trail. Friends of Tryon Creek State Park presents: Natural Cycles: A Celebration of Art in the Forest :: Carrie Bodle\'s Walking/Listening/Recording: Tryon Creek State Park. September 17, 2006 – August 2007 Opening Reception Sunday, September 17th, 2006 5:00 - 7:00pm Location: Tryon Creek State Park, Portland, Oregon Artists: Julian Voss-Andreae Christine Harrington Leta Evaskus Carrie Bodle Martha Morgan Charissa Brock Contact: Stephanie Wagner Executive Director 503-636-4398 www.tryonfriends.org

properties.name: Weapons of Mass Compassion
properties.description: Posted by Jason   NW 6th Ave near Everett, Portland, ORA friend of me "leopard haired friend" has a gallery with a small politically charged store up front. There are books about Iraq\'s underground fight for freedom against red white & blue imperialism, gilded skulls and pistols, as well as random artist made tshirts. Curious if the shop part is open regularly, or if it\'s more of an \'exhibit store\'?
